Name: 0 Series Shinkansen Speed: 210 km/h Model creation: 1964

History:

The 0 Series Shinkansen was created to connect major cities across Japan, revolutionizing transportation in the country. Its streamlined design set the standard for future high-speed rail developments worldwide.

Facts:

Introduced in 1964, the 0 Series Shinkansen was Japan's first high-speed train, capable of reaching speeds up to 210 km/h. It transformed rail travel in Japan and set the benchmark for high-speed rail systems globally, featuring a streamlined design for efficient and comfortable travel.
